data.title: Jump to logical EOL as well as Physical EOL
data.body:
When line-wrap is enables, logical EOL != physical EOL. With [End] key could only jump to logical EOL

Would greatly help with editing LONG lines in the files

data.title: Cannot find module 'gc-signals' when running tests on windows
data.body:
I synced after the fix for #22019 went in and now I get a different module error when trying to run tests.

OS: Windows 10
Steps to Reproduce:
* Sync latest (here I have the github repo in a remote named upstream and I pull from the master branch) and reinstall in case dependencies have changed, then open code
```
git pull upstream master
scripts\npm install
code .
```
* Use ctrl+b to run the build task. After it completes, terminate the task
* Open the command palette and "Run test task"

**Expected:** test task runs
**Actual:** Error
```
Starting 'test'...
{ errorCode: 'load',
  moduleId: 'gc-signals',
  neededBy: [ 'vs/workbench/api/node/mainThreadHeapService' ],
  ...
```

data.title: HTML "script" tags improperly scoped
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (5e9357bd5111eacf2b8fb39455c8afb5a42d632f, 2017-03-07T07:07:17.647Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.5.1|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.12.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.3|
|nord-visual-studio-code|arcticicestudio|0.1.1|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.0.3|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|11.0.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|vscode-csscomb|mrmlnc|4.0.1|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.3|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.23.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|1.2.0|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.4.5|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

Please see attached screenshots:  the `=` for attributes is not the same color for `script` tags as all other html tags.

This is because all other tags they are scoped `meta.tag.inline.any.html`, whilst script tags are only `text.html.basic`. This is a bug IMHO.

Script tag:

data.title: Scrolling jittering after a day
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Versi√≥n 10.0.14393]

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Work one day as usual. 
2. Performing scroll with the wheel mouse and/or two fingers touch-pad gesture.
3. The source code start jittering during scrolling.

Work around:
1. open CMD.
2. Go to %appdata%\code (cd %appData%\code)
3. Delete everything but storage.json and Users\settings.json.
4. Start vscode again and works properly... for one day. On next day, the problem comes back.

Others work around:
Uninstalling, deleting everything and reinstalling the app. 
Using another account. 
Using different mouse (Bluetooth, wired, wireless, many vendors).

data.title: Debugger unable to attach to node process (node version 0.12.12)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run a nodejs script with node version 0.12.12 (node --debug test.js)
2. Try to attach to the process
Fails to attach with error: Attach to process: cannot enable debug mode for process '2976' (Error: Command failed: node -e process._debugProcess(2976)

Attach works fine with Webstorm. However, we really want to use Node. We cannot upgrade node version, since this is the version we are stuck with on production for the next 6 months.

data.title: column breakpoints displayed when i edit a line
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/23673465/3f274474-0327-11e7-951e-b796d2903aa4.png)

- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `yo code`
2. `npm install && code-insiders .`
3. open `extension.ts`
4. put breakpoint on line 17 (`let disposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand...`
5. `F5` to run
6. In development instance, press F1 and run Hello World command
7. Hit breakpoint
8. Step
9. Put breakpoint on line 22 (`vscode.window.showInformationMessage...`)
10. Press `F5`, hit breakpoint, press `F5` again to continue
11. Stop debugging
12. put cursor at end of line 17 in `extension.ts`, press ENTER

Result:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/23673457/37f11cc0-0327-11e7-9242-56fb86ecb4a8.png)

I get this a lot when debugging and editing an extension in TypeScript, not just in this single scenario.

data.title: Color coded project identification
data.body:
Hi, it would be awesome if there was some way to easily identify which open VSCODE window is which project.  Preferably with a color coding system similar to how the bottom git bar is colored.  

_Top Bar_
Perhaps the top bar with the project name / file name could be utilized to change the background color. Maybe the user settings could implement something like: `"window.titleBar": [ { "path": "/project/location", "bar_color": "#5a6b7c", "font_color": "#ffffff" } ]` which defaults to the current (based of theme?) color settings.

_Side Bar_
Or perhaps colorize the side bar which houses Explorer, Search, Git, etc. it could use a similar implementation: `"window.sideBar": [ { "path": "/project/location", "bar_color": "#5a6b7c", "icon_color": "#ffffff" } ]`

I dont know if this feature exists already in the form of an extension, i did a search but couldnt find something that matched what i needed.  If anyone knows an extension or even a value to set in the settings, i would be much appreciated.

Thank you, and keep up the good work!

data.title: Server initialization failed.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.10.1
- OS Version:
10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:
Obviously a rare case, but whenever I try to start debugging **anything** I get this in the Output pane:
```
Server initialization failed.
Message: Request initialize failed with message: Cannot read property 'replace' of null
  Code: -32603 
```

The debug console just says "`node`"

Problems pane: `no problems have been detected in your workspace so far.`

data.title: Spinner or indicator while saving
data.body: Hi! Probably I'm not the only one that uses VSCode on NFS Folders or slow filesystems. Right now, when saving a file (cmd+s), the modified file indicator (white dot) dissapears only when the save is done, but there is no indicator for "you have already pressed save" or "saving is in progress". Its really painful because on slow filesystems or slow networks the save process can take up to 10s and its easy to forget if you already pressed save. A simple solution would be to change the "white dot" to something else while saving. ### Current behaviour: Pending Changes: Saving: Saved: ### Desired behaviour: Pending Changes: Saving (just an idea): Saved:

data.title: Mac OS X: Change shell for integrated terminal
data.body:
I'd like to change the shell for the integrated terminal, without changing my default shell, on Mac OS X. I'd like to keep ZSH as my default shell, but change my integrated terminal to use PowerShell. From the documentation, it seems that this capability is exclusive to the Windows version of VSCode. Can this capability be added to Linux and Mac versions of VSCode as well?

Cheers,
**Trevor Sullivan**
Docker Captain
Microsoft MVP: Cloud & Data Center Management
https://trevorsullivan.net
https://twitter.com/pcgeek86

data.title: Settings editor - Put cursor at current find result

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- Open settings editor
- cmd+f to do a search
- Press enter to focus a search result that exists in your settings.json
- Press cmd+1 to move focus to settings.json

The cursor should be at the current highlighted search result, but instead it's just at its previous location.

data.title: Settings editor - shift+enter should search backwards

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- Open settings editor
- press cmd+f to do a search
- enter searches forward, shift+enter should search backwards

Also consider hooking up F3 and cmd+g

data.title: More task output windows
data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

It would be absolutely great to have a possibility to allow VSCode to open New Task Output window for each triggered task. Why? It is a must have especially when running tests by Task. Because every newly triggered task clears the output of previous test run...and that's a pain if you don't remember all the test failures (no one does ;), because then you have to run all tests again. Uselessly, just because you triggered something after the first test run.

It could have the same ComboBox UI as more Terminal windows have.

(and use Terminal itself to run tests is not the solution, because such task can not be assigned to a keyboard shortcut, afaik)

Thanks for evaluation!

data.title: More friendly terminating of running task
data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

It is a bit lengthy to terminate current running task by "cmd+shift+p term up|down to select Tasks: Terminate Running Task and Enter".

It would be great to have e.g.
- Terminate Task context action on Task Output window, or better
- to have a button inside Output Window which will terminate current task (Terminal window also have custom icons at the top right corner ;)

Thanks for evaluating!

data.title: Always fails to launch any external program
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:27:09.350Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.2|
|cmake|twxs|0.0.15|;

---

When trying to compile a C++ project, VSCode tells me it "Failed to launch external program sh -c". `process.env.PATH` looks like it's correctly populated. Replacing `sh` with `/bin/sh` or `bash` or `/bin/bash` in tasks.json doesn't work. Whether I use bash or fish as login shell does not seem to matter; the problem always occurs. Launching Code via the Finder or command line also does not matter.

This does not seem to be the same as #21655 or #8434, which had to do with incorrectly parsed $PATHs. @joaomoreno 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to compile a project using shift-command-B

data.title: Set env to extensionHost type in launch.json did not work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm working on a vscode extension development, and my launch.json here:

```js
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Extension",
            "type": "extensionHost",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

And `env` seems not to be set. I try to follow the prompt here:

```
"node2" is no longer supported, use "node" instead and set the "protocol" attribute to "inspector".
```

And modify my launch.json like this:

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch Extension",
            "type": "node",
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
            "args": ["--extensionDevelopmentPath=${workspaceRoot}" ],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

But got the connection timeout error here:

```
Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:28486).
```
